dt: {bc}the original pattern or model of which all things of the same type are representations or copies {bc}{sx|prototype||}

dt.t: … the House of Commons, the {wi}archetype{/wi} of all the representative assemblies which now meet …
He is the {wi}archetype{/wi} of a successful businessman.

dt: {bc}an inherited idea or mode of thought in the psychology of Carl Gustav Jung that is derived from the experience of the race and is present in the unconscious of the individual

et: Latin {it}archetypum{/it}, from Greek {it}archetypon{/it}, from neuter of {it}archetypos{/it} archetypal, from {it}archein{/it} + {it}typos{/it} type
shortdef: the original pattern or model of which all things of the same type are representations or copies : prototype; also : a perfect example
an inherited idea or mode of thought in the psychology of Carl Gustav Jung that is derived from the experience of the race and is present in the unconscious of the individual
